problems.title: Longest Substring With At Least K Repeating Characters (Sliding Window)
problems.description:
Given a string s and an integer k, return the length of the longest substring of s such that the frequency of each character in this substring is greater than or equal to k.
If no such substring exists, return 0.

Input Format:
First line: string s.
Second line: integer k.

Output Format:
Print a single integer: the length of the longest valid substring.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
aaabb
3

Sample Output
3

Explanation: The longest substring is "aaa", as 'a' is repeated 3 times.
problems.constraints:
1 <= s.length <= 10^4
s consists of only lowercase English letters.
1 <= k <= 10^5
hintsList: Think about how to use a sliding window to optimize the solution.
Consider using a frequency map or two pointers to track the window state.
